_header: This is my song in my old age
_description: A song of Old Age with the burden, ‘Timor mortis conturbat me’ — nine twelve-line stanzas

Longleat29.First Lines:
þys is my song in my old ageWyle y was ȝonge y
                    myght nat see þe streyte waye to my last age…
Longleat29.Last Lines:
…So þat who neuer haue cause to saytimor mortis conturbat
                    meAmen ffor charite
Longleat29.Editions:
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             “A Middle English Timor Mortis Poem.” 
             Modern Language Review
         28 (1933): 234-38: 235-7.
